content: Is there a way to configure Zulip to use the Unicode character of emoji instead of an image?
No currently there is no way to do so. However I wonder why would you like to do so?
https://chat.zulip.org/#settings/display-settings has a setting that will display the emoji as :tomato: instead of . Also curious what the use case is here.
That setting currently works only for reactions.
There is an open issue for making it work for emojis in messages(which will be workable once the emoji-web PR gets merged).
The emoji images that Zulip uses are ugly. I don't like them.
Soon we are going to add an option to change the emojiset.
Also it takes some time for the emoji to load. And if the connection is lost, no emoji is shown.
If they where Unicode characters, that wouldn't happen.
I think you are referring here to the delay in loading emojis in emoji picker, right? This is because of the sprite sheets we use for displaying them.
If they were unicode characters, it is possible that for some emojis your system don't have necessary fonts to display them correctly in which case they will be rendered as blank boxes.
This was an issue we recently encountered in our twitter integration which used unicode emojis instead of sprite sheets and on some systems they were rendered as blank boxes.
